title: Stable Diffusion in your pocket? “Draw Things” brings AI images to iPhone
description: It's not fast, but it's free—and it runs locally on pocket-sized hardware.

title: Reddit now lets you mute subreddits you don’t like
description: The muting feature comes first to Android and iOS, later to desktop and the web.

title: Measles outbreak erupts among unvaccinated children in Ohio daycare
description: Officials reportedly expect that more cases will be identified.

title: Spotify is the first to launch non-Google Android billing in the US
description: Spotify is the first partner for Google Play's "User Choice Billing."

title: A search bar is among the Task Manager improvements in new Windows 11 build
description: New theme options and a better toggle for Efficiency mode are also in testing.

title: Musk-fueled chaos at Twitter makes it hard to comply with FTC privacy order
description: Musk's rapid product launches may run afoul of mandates from FTC privacy decree.

title: Single Hubble image captured supernova at three different times
description: An image taken in 2010 captured the lensed supernova, but nobody noticed.

title: Still the best tablet-laptop: Microsoft’s Surface Pro 9 review
description: The removal of the headphone jack is the only new thing that's wrong with it.

title: Apple and Amazon colluded to raise iPhone and iPad prices, class action claims
description: Lawsuit claims Amazon and Apple benefited from fewer vendors, higher prices.

title: Twitter’s new leaders charged with helping Musk execute “dumb things”
description: Twitter’s new guard will be charged with checking Musk’s worst instincts.

title: Take that! Octopuses caught on camera vigorously throwing debris at each other
description: It's the first time this kind of throwing behavior has been reported in octopuses.

title: Modder makes an Apple M1-powered Wii for retro gaming
description: Apple power meets Nintendo nostalgia.

title: Google refunding three years of Stadia purchases starting this week
description: Refunding years of purchases will be a logistics nightmare.

title: Musk bans remote work at Twitter, warns staff of “dire” economic outlook
description: Twitter staff must be in office 40 hours a week unless Musk approves exception.

title: For $8, Twitter Blue users create a wave of checkmarked imposter accounts
description: Most fake accounts are suspended quickly, but not before some brand damage is done.

title: The best wireless mechanical keyboards
description: Want mechanical typing without bulky cables? Here are our 4 favorite options.

title: NASA leaves its Artemis I rocket exposed to winds above design limits
description: NASA likely to begin inspections of the rocket and spacecraft later today.

title: FTX on brink of collapse after Binance abandons rescue
description: Crypto exchange dashes to fill $8 billion hole as investors write down equity.

title: Lenovo patches secure boot vulnerabilities that imperil 25 notebook models
description: Hackers can exploit vulnerabilities to install malicious firmware that survives reboots.

title: Ancient wisdom: Oldest full sentence in first alphabet is about head lice
description: "May this [ivory] tusk root out the lice of the hair and the beard."
